qas.question: When were laws first created to regulate pesticides?
What might someone knowledgable about the history of pesticides call ther period of the 1940s and 1950s?
When did America establish the Environmental Protection Agency?
Countries which are established use what amount of pesticides?
Trends about use of pesticides have been published from which country?
What were laws first created to regulate in 1940?
What did manufacturers produce in large quantities in 1910?
What is 1910 considered the start of according to some sources?
How much has pesticide use increased by since 1910?
How many pesticides were used in 1910?

context: The first legislation providing federal authority for regulating <b5_0>pesticides<b5_0/> was enacted in <a0_0>1910<a0_0/>; however, decades later during the 1940s manufacturers began to produce large amounts of <b6_0>synthetic pesticides<b6_0/> and their use became widespread. Some sources consider the 1940s and 1950s to have been the start of <b7_0>the "<a1_0>pesticide era<b7_0/><a1_0/>." Although the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency was established in <a2_0>1970<a2_0/> and amendments to the pesticide law in 1972, pesticide use has increased <b8_0>50-fold<b8_0/> since 1950 and <b9_0>2.3 million tonnes<b9_0/> (2.5 million short tons) of industrial pesticides are now[when?] used each year. <a3_0>Seventy-five percent<a3_0/> of all pesticides in the world are used in developed countries, but use in developing countries is increasing. A study of <a4_0>USA<a4_0/> pesticide use trends through 1997 was published in 2003 by the National Science Foundation's Center for Integrated Pest Management.
